alert.note: Alert for Claiborne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 24 at 1:10PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Webster, northwestern Claiborne and central Bossier Parishes through 200 PM CST... At 109 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Haynesville to 6 miles north of Bossier City. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Bossier City, Minden, Homer, Haughton, Haynesville, Sibley, Cotton Valley, Doyline, Dixie Inn, Eastwood, Evergreen, Ferguson, Leton, Princeton, Fillmore, Holly Springs, Bellevue, Antioch, Gilark and Couchwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
